data.title: Info translated to other languages
data.meta_description: Key information about how to ride Chicago Transit in multiple languages.
data.text:
Welcome to Chicago transit

This section of our website helps people who do not speak English as their primary language understand the basics about how to ride transit.

Additionally, this entire website is designed to be compatible with many online translation services that can automatically translate information into many languages from around the world.

We've produced a quick overview to how to ride CTA available both in professionally translated formats for some of the most commonly spoken non-English languages in Chicago, as well as provide direct links to the same information as translated by Google Translate in a greater number of languages.

Non-English language guides

These introductions to CTA service are available in the following languages (and have been professionally translated):

[ES] Spanish - Guía en español

[PL] Polish - Informacje o polskim przewodniku

[ZH] Chinese (Simplified) - 中文（简体）指南

[TL] Tagalog - Impormasyon sa Tagalog

Additionally, the same information is available through computer-based translation with Google Translate (which may make occasional mistakes and thus should be considered experimental), via these convenient links, below:

[AR] Arabic - العربية

[ZH] Chinese (Simplified) - 中文

[FR] French - français

[DE] German - Deutsch

[HI] Hindi - हिन्दी

[IT] Italian - italiano

[JA] Japanese - 日本語

[KO] Korean - 한국어

[PL] Polish - język polski

[RU] Russian - русский язык

[ES] Spanish - español

[TL] Tagalog - Wikang Tagalog

[TH] Thai - ไทย

[UK] Ukrainian - українська мова

[UR] Urdu - اردو

[VI] Vietnamese - Tiếng Việt

Many other languages are supported by this site through Google Translate and other online translation services, including those automated translations available in your computer or phone's built-in browser.
